macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Major U.S. Stock Indices Close Below Record Levels
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.1% to 6,940.01, the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.2% to 49,359.33, and the Nasdaq composite dropped 0.1% to 23,515.39, all sitting just below their recent records set on Monday. Each index notched weekly losses despite technology stocks providing support.

items.title: Technology Stocks Drive Market, Semiconductor Companies Rally
items.summary: Broadcom rose 2.5% and Micron Technology surged 7.8%, leading technology sector gains that helped offset losses in other areas. Big Tech companies with outsized valuations continued to push market movements.

items.title: Mixed Bank Earnings Results Drive Financial Sector Volatility
items.summary: Regional and major banks reported fourth-quarter earnings with mixed results. PNC jumped 3.8% after beating forecasts, while Regions Financial fell 2.6% after missing expectations. Major banks including JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America declined over 2%, though Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs posted gains of 5.8% and 4.6% respectively following earnings beats.
items.source: Los Angeles Times / AP Wire / Investing.com

items.title: Treasury Yields Rise Amid Economic Data
items.summary: The 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.23% from 4.17%, while the 2-year Treasury yield climbed to 3.60% from 3.57%. JOLTS data showed a sharp drop in job openings signaling cooling labor demand, though ADP reported a modest rebound in private-sector hiring.
items.source: Los Angeles Times / AP Wire / Trading Economics

items.title: Gold Prices Decline Despite January Gains
items.summary: Gold prices fell 0.6% but remain up more than 5% for January, reflecting continued volatility in the precious metal market amid economic and geopolitical uncertainty.

items.title: Moderna Raises 2025 Revenue Forecast, Stock Surges
items.summary: Moderna rose 17% on Tuesday and is up 20% for the week after raising its full-year 2025 revenue forecast to approximately $1.9 billion, $100 million above the previous midpoint guidance.

items.title: Boston Scientific to Acquire Penumbra for $14.5 Billion
items.summary: Penumbra stock rallied 10.8% in the last week following Boston Scientific's agreement to acquire the medical technology company for $374 per share, representing a 19.3% premium. The deal is expected to close later in 2026.

items.title: CoreWeave Stock Rallies on AI Infrastructure Demand
items.summary: CoreWeave stock rose 12.2% on Monday and has rallied over 28% in the last week, reflecting strong investor interest in AI infrastructure companies.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.07% to $3.23T Amid Mixed Trading
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market capitalization fell 1.07% over the past 24 hours to $3.23T, with Bitcoin trading at $95,221 down 0.53% after fluctuating between $94,293 and $95,809. Major outperformers include DUSK (+81%), AXS (+39%), and SLP (+26%).

items.title: Bitcoin Breaks $95K Resistance, Touches $98K with ETF Inflows Surging
items.summary: Bitcoin surged past two-week $95K resistance, briefly hitting $98K on January 14, supported by $1.7B in weekly ETF inflows including a record $843.6M on January 15; exchange balances hit lowest since 2017 at 1.8M BTC.

items.title: Kazakhstan Enacts Legislation to Regulate Digital Financial Assets
items.summary: Kazakhstan has passed new legislation to regulate digital financial assets, marking a significant regulatory development in the region.

items.title: Moldova Adopts EU-Style MiCA Crypto Regulation Framework by 2026
items.summary: Moldova is moving to regulate cryptocurrencies under an EU-style MiCA framework by 2026, aligning with broader European standards.

items.title: Ethereum Network Activity Doubles with Surge in New Users
items.summary: Ethereum activity has doubled as new users flood the network, according to Glassnode data, with ETH priced at $3,296 down 0.48%.

items.title: Steak 'n Shake Adds $10M in Bitcoin to Strategic Reserve
items.summary: Burger chain Steak 'n Shake purchased $10 million in Bitcoin for its treasury, building on its acceptance of BTC payments since last year.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Yann LeCun Departs Meta, Calls LLMs 'Dead End' for Superintelligence
items.summary: Yann LeCun left Meta, criticizing large language models as a dead end for superintelligence and accusing Meta of fudging Llama 4 benchmarks. This highlights fundamental disagreements in AI direction amid over 200 recent announcements.

items.title: Study Demonstrates Quantum Computers Measuring Semantic Similarity in Language Models
items.summary: A peer-reviewed study shows quantum computers can estimate semantic similarity in language models using real hardware, mapping embeddings to quantum states via interference effects. It proves feasibility but no performance gains over classical methods.

items.title: AI Model Maps Key Factors Influencing Global Cancer Survival Rates
items.summary: Researchers used machine learning to analyze data from 185 countries, identifying factors like radiotherapy access and universal health coverage most linked to better cancer survival. An online tool allows country-specific insights.

items.title: OpenAI Plans to Introduce Ads in ChatGPT for U.S. Users
items.summary: OpenAI will test ads in ChatGPT for logged-in U.S. adults on free and Go tiers, without affecting answers or selling conversations, to create new revenue amid high costs and 800 million weekly users.

items.title: AI Demand Predicted to Drive Nuclear Power Renaissance
items.summary: Expanding AI data processing power needs, potentially exceeding U.S. industrial consumption by decade's end, may spur nuclear power growth. Global leaders discussed AI-nuclear synergies at IAEA.

items.title: Nvidia Launches Rubin Platform; OpenAI and Anthropic Enter Healthcare AI
items.summary: Nvidia unveiled Rubin chip architecture at CES, while OpenAI and Anthropic launched healthcare products within days, signaling competitive positioning. Google DeepMind partnered with Boston Dynamics for Gemini in robots.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon Released
items.summary: Nihon Falcom's latest JRPG, the thirteenth main installment in the Trails series continuing the Calvard arc, launched on January 15, 2026 for PC, PlayStation, and Nintendo Switch.

items.title: Deep Fringe Enters Early Access
items.summary: Bosoneon Studio's intriguing new title Deep Fringe launched in early access on PC on January 15, 2026.

items.title: Archon Soul Prologue Now Available
items.summary: PolyGryph's 2D roguelike dice-builder Archon Soul debuted with a free prologue on PC on January 12, 2026, emphasizing strategic customization.

items.title: Gamers Dive into God of War and Assassin's Creed Shadows This Weekend
items.summary: XboxEra contributors highlight playing 2018's God of War on PC and Xbox, and the expanded Assassin's Creed Shadows with its new level cap, endgame content, and Claws of Awaji expansion.

items.title: Retro Gaming: 2002 Apple eMac Tested in 2025
items.summary: A restored 2002 Apple eMac with 700 MHz PowerPC G4 runs the Mac port of Halo adequately but struggles with Minecraft, showcasing its educational market capabilities.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump Administration Pushes Tech Companies to Fund $15B Power Plant Investment
items.summary: The Trump administration is pressuring major tech companies to invest $15 billion in new power generation for the PJM Interconnection grid serving 65 million people across 13 Mid-Atlantic and Midwest states, citing increased electricity demand and rising rates.

items.title: Software Stocks Rally as Analysts See Bargain Opportunities After Recent Selloff
items.summary: High-growth software stocks have declined significantly, prompting Wall Street analysts to recommend selective buying in companies like Microsoft, Snowflake, and Datadog as potential value opportunities for 2026.
